oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis and crystallographic characterization of some derivatives of benzimidazole
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DAS, TM
RAO, CP
KALLE, N
RISSANEN, K
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: n-glycosylamines
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three derivatives of benzimidazole have been synthesized and characterized based on H-1 and C-13 NMR, FTIR, FAB-mass and UV spectra, and the structures of two compounds are characterized based on single crystal XRD studies. Existence of both inter- and intra-molecular hydrogen bonds has been identified in the case of 2-(o-aminophenyl)benzimidazole amine and not in case of N-methyl-2-(o-nitrophenyl)benzimidazole. While the former is a completely planar molecule, the latter is not. Both the compounds exhibit interesting lattice structures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INDIAN JOURNAL OF CHEMISTRY SECTION B-ORGANIC CHEMISTRY INCLUDING MEDICINAL CHEMISTRY, 42(3), 661-665
